column4: Does anyone know how to get tab completion to work in the grub shell?
Actually, the grub shell even TELLS you it has tab completion, but doesn't.
but <TAB> isn't even completing commands, let alone drive designations or filenames.
I feel too stupid right now to calculate which drive my usb stick is right now
in grub, but thanks for playing
if I needed that info, I'd just run "mount" with no options.
Anyway, I am making /home symlink to another drive whihc I have more space on how do I remove ~.gvfs
you may need to enter single user mode to do that
